application.util

Class LocationObservableListBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.util.LocationObservableListBuilder

  • public class LocationObservableListBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This method builds a master list of LocationObjs from the Database then builds observable lists of RoomObjs, BLDGObjs, and CampusObjs from the master list based on selections made in the dropdown list then sorts the observable lists alphabetically and returns them to the GUI.
    Author:
    Patrick Scott Hadley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocationObservableListBuilder()
      This method Initializes the Lists to ArrayLists and then makes those lists Observable, while adding the default list values for each in the allLocationsList

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToAllLocationsList(java.lang.String camp, java.lang.String bldg, java.lang.String rm)
      This method adds each new Location to the allLocationsList when called by the DBInteractionObj and ObjConstructor.
      void buildLists()
      This method controls the process of Initialy filtering duplicate listings from each observable list after all values are Initially added from the database, then calls methods to sort each observable list alphabetically.
      javafx.collections.ObservableList<BLDGObj> getBLDGList()
      This method returns the observable list of BLDGObjs.
      javafx.collections.ObservableList<CampusObj> getCampusList()
      This method returns the observable list of CampusObjs.
      javafx.collections.ObservableList<RoomObj> getRMList()
      This method returns the observable list of RoomObjs.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method is used for testing purposes.
      void printObservableLists()
      For testing purposes This method prints lists of each observable list to the console
      void reBuildLists(java.lang.String campSelection, java.lang.String bldgSelection, java.lang.String rmSelection)
      This method will rebuild the observable lists based on the selection state of the dropdowns passed in as parameters by clearing the existing observable lists then filtering duplicate listings from of the lists then sorting the observable lists alphabetically.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • buildLists

        public void buildLists()
        This method controls the process of Initialy filtering duplicate listings from each observable list after all values are Initially added from the database, then calls methods to sort each observable list alphabetically.

      • reBuildLists

        public void reBuildLists(java.lang.String campSelection,
                         java.lang.String bldgSelection,
                         java.lang.String rmSelection)
        This method will rebuild the observable lists based on the selection state of the dropdowns passed in as parameters by clearing the existing observable lists then filtering duplicate listings from of the lists then sorting the observable lists alphabetically.
        Parameters:
        campSelection -
        bldgSelection -
        rmSelection -
